items.sentence: Tom told me what Mary had told him to tell me.
Have you ever driven a four-wheel drive truck?
What time will we be leaving tomorrow morning?
I admit this may not be the best way to do it.
Tom was in Mary's car the last time I saw him.
We were glad to hear that Tom got back safely.
I can never tell if you are joking or serious.
I'm thinking of hiring a financial consultant.
I'm not thinking about anything in particular.
I'm going to install solar panels on my house.
I'm so glad I'm not living in the Middle Ages.
I'm going to miss having you around the house.
Tom asked Mary if she knew John's new address.
I wasn't conscious that I was tapping my foot.
Let's get out of here before somebody sees us.
Last Monday, I stayed at home and read a book.
You aren't supposed to be doing that, are you?
You aren't actually going to do that, are you?
Did you notice the shocked look on Tom's face?
Tom was willing to do what we asked him to do.
